Yes, protecting your eyes from UV rays while hiking or camping is very important to maintain good eye health. Here are some tips on how to properly protect your eyes:

1. Wear sunglasses with UV protection: When buying sunglasses, make sure they provide both UVA and UVB protection.  Sunglasses with wraparound lenses provide the most protection.

2. Wear a hat: Wearing a hat with a brim can protect your eyes and face from direct sunlight and UV rays.

3. Use sunscreen: Apply sunscreen around your eyes and lids to protect the skin against UV.

4. Choose your timing carefully: If possible, avoid being outside during the hours when the sun is strongest (10 am - 2 pm).

5. Take breaks in the shade: Take breaks in shaded areas or carry a portable canopy with you.

Remember: Cumulative sun damage on your eyes can lead to various eye conditions such as cataracts or macular degeneration. By following the above tips, you can protect your eyes while hiking or camping and keep them healthy.
